question_text: Which of the following are true about APIPA behavior? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: APIPA uses ARP to check for duplicate addresses
APIPA is only used in IPv6 environments
Devices using APIPA can still reach external DNS servers
APIPA enables limited local communication between devices
correct_answer: APIPA uses ARP to check for duplicate addresses
APIPA enables limited local communication between devices
explanation: APIPA allows link-local communication on the same subnet, uses ARP for collision avoidance, and cannot reach beyond the local network.
